I've been a software test manager for about 5 of the past 10 years, and
learned much of what I know from reading "STQE" magazine, now called
"Better Software".  If you can get a subscription to that in Germany,
I'd recommend it.  They also have a lot of good system testing content
on their website: http://stickyminds.com.  
 
Finally, don't underestimate the benefit of hiring a consulting for a
month or two to help jump start your system test program.  I'd recommend
that the consultant should be me and that the month or two should
include Oktoberfest.  (just kidding)
 
 
Todd.

	Hi all -
	
	forgive me for this OT posting - but I hope that you can shed
light on that
	topic; and/or send me to a more appropriate community. Thx!
	(I asked on softwaretestingexperts@yahoogroups, but this is more
sort of a
	job listing group).
	
	---------
	
	I am in an company with about 50 developers (+ management) which
now
	wants/has to set up a system test group = probably 10..15 people
who do
	system testing (we have 10 "country versions" of our software
and up to 3
	versions per country in the field, up to 3 versions "in the
making").
	I do know about 
	
	* testing from a testers perspective (my favorite book:
B.Beizer's "Black
	Box Testing")
	
	* testing in the developer community (JUnit testing is done,
although
	haphazardly, by about 50% of the developers; direct application
tests are
	done by many developers)
	
	but I do NOT know much about "higher level issues" like
	
	* input quality level for system tests done by the system test
group (how to
	define and ascertain it?)
	* management of the system test group
	* conflict resolution between development and system test group
	* and what else?
	
	Is there any literature out there (books, on the net, ...) that
could be
	helpful? (yes, I did a google, but up to now the results are
"quite mixed").
	
	Also, anyone who has experience to share is very welcome!
	
	Thank you!
	Harald M. Mueller
	Germany
